element.name: The Lost Dungeon of Rickedness: Big Rick Energy

p.strong: Play D&D through the lenses of the mad narcissistic genius, Rick Sanchez, from the animated Cartoon Network series, Rick and Morty—the Rick Way!

description.p: This tabletop roleplaying game boxed set blends the world of Dungeons & Dragons with mad narcissistic genius, Rick Sanchez’s power gaming sensibilities, nostalgia, sarcastic metacommentary, and the reasons why people play D&D in the first place.

element.name: Concertina
element.source: The Lost Dungeon of Rickedness: Big Rick Energy

description.p: A concertina is a less charming kind of accordion.
In addition to knocking out a killer polka, a creature playing the concertina can use an action to cause an area of mist or water up to 30 feet in diameter and 6 inches deep to freeze solid.
Once used, this feature of the concertina can't be used again until the next dawn.

Any creatures touching the floor must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained by the ice. As an action, a restrained creature can attempt to free itself or another creature within its reach from the ice, doing so with a successful DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check. A character freed from the ice is no longer restrained by it. The ice melts in an hour.

element.name: Shapeshifter
element.source: The Lost Dungeon of Rickedness: Big Rick Energy

description.p: You can use your action to polymorph into a Small pickle-humanoid hybrid or into a Small pickle, or back into your true form, which is humanoid. Your statistics, other than size, are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. You reverts to your true form if you dies.

sheet.description: You can transform into a small pickle or your hybrid form. End the transformation if you die.
